STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 9, 2023
Kyle Alexander Rambo
CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF THE UPPER PENINSULA
427 S STEPHENSON AVE STE 215,
IRON MOUNTAIN, MI, 49801-3458
RE: License#: CB220201016
Dear Rambo,
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on May 9, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 734-775-8293
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has
been given an application for renewal of the license
not less than 60 calendar days before the expiration
date of the license.
Three foster home files were reviewed. One of three files documented that the
application was sent less than sixty days before the expiration of the license. The
license was set to expire on January 21, 2023 and the application was sent to the
foster parent on January 4, 2023.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker
must obtain signatures from the following
individuals, as applicable:
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line
supervisor, when siblings in care are placed apart. •
Parents who are a member of a participating
household. • Youth ages 14 and older. • Foster
parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated court
ordered caregivers.

Three foster care files and 6 service plans were reviewed. Two of 6 service plans
documented late signatures. A service plan dated December 15, 2022, did not
document the fosater parent signatures. A service plan dated March 15, 2023
was signed late by the foster parent on April 18, 2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding the structure and the writing of
corrective action plans.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plan during this period under review in
response to those rule violations established during the Interim Inspection
completed on October 4, 2022. The current Renewal Inspection did not establish
any repeat violations indicating the agency CAP was sucessful in preventing
repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment The Chief Administrators annual assessment
was reviewed. The Chief Administrators Assessment was detailed and thorough
and offers the following information. The assessment identified that staff turnover
remains a challenge for the agency, recently the agency lost it’s foster care
program supervisor. Given that the agency is small the loss of one staff can have
a significant impact upon the agency. The agency cross trains its employees to
minimize the impact of staffing losses.
Financial Overview
The agency budget was reviewed and the agency is fiscally viable. The agency
had an annual audit conducted by a certified public accountant and this document
was reviewed.

Staff and Youth Interviews
The agency Foster Care Worker and Program Supervisor were interviewed. The
Foster Care Worker reported that she feels supported by her supervisor and the
agency administration. She further stated that she feels there is a strong team,
though small, at the agency. The Foster Care Supervisor recently assumed the
role after the pervious supervisor left the agency. She reported that she feels that
agency has good workers and everyone works as a team.
No interviews of youth were conducted by the Consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has sufficient office space and is well organized and equipped.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The Field Analyst identified three safety alerts during her visits to foster homes. The
safety alerts are as follows.
Safety Alert 1. On February 15, 2023, the Analyst filed a complaint as the home
was under construction and the only access to a bathroom was through a bedroom.
The Bedroom entranceway did not have a door that could be latched. The agency
initiated special evaluation #2023C0000369, and a variance was submitted. A CAP
was generated on February 20, 2023.
Safety Alert 2. On February 15, 2023, the Analyst identified that a smoke alarm was
missing in the basement of the home. The agency was notified of the safety alert on
the same date. An alarm was installed on February 16, 2023, and photos provided.
Safety Alert 3. On February 16, 2023, the Analyst identified that there was no
smoke alarm in the basement of the home. The agency was notified on the same
date and an alarm was installed on February 17, 2023, and photos of the installed
alarm were provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
_____________________________________

Douglas Turrill Date May 9, 2023
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
_____________________________________
Linda D Tansil Date
Area Manager
